instruction: How did the researchers evaluate the classification performance of the machine learning algorithms in distinguishing parathyroid glands (PGs) from non-parathyroid gland (NPG) tissues during thyroidectomy using laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS)?
Output: The researchers evaluated the classification performance of the machine learning algorithms by collecting LIBS spectra from smear samples of parathyroid glands (PGs) and non-parathyroid gland (NPG) tissues (thyroid and neck lymph node) of rabbits. They ranked and selected the emission lines observed in the LIBS spectra based on the important weight calculated by random forest (RF). Three machine learning algorithms were then used as classifiers to distinguish PGs from NPGs. The artificial neural network classifier provided the best classification performance.

instruction: Can laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) be considered a superior method for intra-operative identification of parathyroid glands (PGs) during thyroidectomy compared to traditional methods?
